metadata.title: CVE-2018-17434 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - medium
metadata.description:
A SIGFPE signal is raised in the function apply_filters() ofh5repack_filters.c in the HDF HDF5 through 1.10.3 library during anattempted parse of a crafted HDF file, because of incorrect protectionagainst division by zero. It could allow a remote denial of service attack.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-17434` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

hdf5-helpers - 1.10.8+repack-1ubuntu1
hdf5-tools - 1.10.8+repack-1ubuntu1
libhdf5-103-1t64 - 1.10.8+repack-1ubuntu1
libhdf5-cpp-103-1t64 - 1.10.8+repack-1ubuntu1
libhdf5-fortran-102t64 - 1.10.8+repack-1ubuntu1
libhdf5-hl-100t64 - 1.10.8+repack-1ubuntu1
libhdf5-hl-cpp-100t64 - 1.10.8+repack-1ubuntu1
libhdf5-hl-fortran-100t64 - 1.10.8+repack-1ubuntu1
libhdf5-java - 1.10.8+repack-1ubuntu1
libhdf5-jni - 1.10.8+repack-1ubuntu1
libhdf5-mpich-103-1t64 - 1.10.8+repack-1ubuntu1
libhdf5-mpich-cpp-103-1t64 - 1.10.8+repack-1ubuntu1
libhdf5-mpich-fortran-102t64 - 1.10.8+repack-1ubuntu1
libhdf5-mpich-hl-100t64 - 1.10.8+repack-1ubuntu1
libhdf5-mpich-hl-cpp-100t64 - 1.10.8+repack-1ubuntu1
libhdf5-mpich-hl-fortran-100t64 - 1.10.8+repack-1ubuntu1
libhdf5-openmpi-103-1t64 - 1.10.8+repack-1ubuntu1
libhdf5-openmpi-cpp-103-1t64 - 1.10.8+repack-1ubuntu1
libhdf5-openmpi-fortran-102t64 - 1.10.8+repack-1ubuntu1
libhdf5-openmpi-hl-100t64 - 1.10.8+repack-1ubuntu1
libhdf5-openmpi-hl-cpp-100t64 - 1.10.8+repack-1ubuntu1
libhdf5-openmpi-hl-fortran-100t64 - 1.10.8+repack-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: hdf5 package in oracular, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.10.8+repack-1ubuntu1').
